REST API main¶

REST API repository Notes¶

async src.repository.notes.create_note(body: NoteModel, user: User, db: Session) → Note¶

The create_note function creates a new note in the database. :param body: NoteModel: Get the title, description and tags from the request body :param user: User: Get the user from the database :param db: Session: Access the database :return: A note object :doc-author: AR

async src.repository.notes.get_note(note_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Note¶
The get_note function takes in a note_id and user, and returns the Note object with that id.
Args:

note_id (int): The id of the Note to be retrieved. user (User): The User who owns the Note to be retrieved.

Parameters:

  • note_id – int: Get the note with the given id

  • user – User: Get the user who is making the request

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A note object from the database

Doc-author:

AR

async src.repository.notes.get_notes(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Note]¶

The get_notes function returns a list of notes for the given user. :param skip: int: Skip the first n notes :param limit: int: Limit the number of notes that are returned :param user: User: Get the user_id from the database :param db: Session: Access the database :return: A list of notes for a particular user :doc-author: AR

async src.repository.notes.remove_note(note_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Note | None¶
The remove_note function removes a note from the database.
Args:

note_id (int): The id of the note to be removed. user (User): The user who owns the note to be removed. db (Session): A connection to our database, used for querying and deleting notes.

Parameters:

  • note_id – int: Identify the note to be removed

  • user – User: Identify the user who is making the request

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The note that was removed

Doc-author:

AR

async src.repository.notes.update_note(note_id: int, body: NoteUpdate, user: User, db: Session) → Note | None¶

The update_note function updates a note in the database.

Parameters:

  • note_id – int: Identify the note to be deleted

  • body – NoteUpdate: Pass in the updated note information

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to make changes to the note

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated note if the user is authorized to update it, otherwise none

Doc-author:

AR

async src.repository.notes.update_status_note(note_id: int, body: NoteStatusUpdate, user: User, db: Session) → Note | None¶

The update_status_note function updates a note in the database.

Parameters:

  • note_id – int: Identify the note to be deleted

  • body – NoteStatusUpdate: Pass in the updated note information

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to make changes to the note

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated note if the user is authorized to update it, otherwise none

REST API repository Tags¶

async src.repository.tags.create_tag(body: TagModel, user: User, db: Session) → Tag¶

The create_tag function creates a new tag in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – TagModel: Get the name of the tag from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the logged in user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A tag object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.tags.get_tag(tag_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Tag¶
The get_tag function takes in a tag_id and user object, and returns the Tag object with that id.

If no such tag exists, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – int: Get the tag with that id

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A tag object based on the id and user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.tags.get_tags(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Tag]¶

The get_tags function returns a list of tags for the user.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a number of tags in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of tags that are returned

  • user – User: Get the user’s id

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of tags

Doc-author:

AR

async src.repository.tags.remove_tag(tag_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Tag | None¶
The remove_tag function removes a tag from the database.
Args:

tag_id (int): The id of the tag to be removed. user (User): The user who owns the tags being removed. This is used for security purposes, so that users can only remove their own tags and not those of other users. db (Session): A connection to our database, which we use to query and delete data from it.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – int: Specify the tag to be deleted

  • user – User: Get the user’s id

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The tag that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.tags.update_tag(tag_id: int, body: TagModel, user: User, db: Session) → Tag | None¶
The update_tag function updates a tag in the database.
Args:

tag_id (int): The id of the tag to update. body (TagModel): The new data for the updated Tag object. This is a Pydantic model, which means it has been validated against its schema before being passed into this function. See schemas/tag_model for more information on what fields are required and how they are validated by Pydantic models. user (User): A User object representing who is making this request to update a Tag object in our database; we need this so that we can

Parameters:

  • tag_id – int: Identify the tag to be deleted

  • body – TagModel: Get the new tag name from the request body

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is authorized to update the tag

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated tag if it exists, otherwise none

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email address of the user to be confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

Nothing, but it sets the user’s confirmed status to true

Doc-author:

Trelent

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Pass in the usermodel object that is created from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email address of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

The first user in the database with the given email address

Doc-author:

Trelent

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – Identify the user to update

  • url – str: Pass the url of the avatar image to be updated

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user to update

  • token – Union[str: Define the type of data that is expected to be passed into the function

  • None] – Indicate that the token parameter can be either a string or none

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

Nothing

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

body (ContactCreate): The contact to create. user (User): The current user, who is creating the contact.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactCreate: Get the data from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The contact object

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶
The get_contact function takes in a contact_id and user, and returns the contact with that id.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the desired Contact object. user (User): The User object associated with this request.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id that is being searched for

  • user – User: Get the user id of the current logged in user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object for a given user, if it exists

Doc-author:

AR

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a number of rows in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts for the given user

Doc-author:

AR

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database. Args: contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. user (User): The user who is removing the contact. This is used to ensure that only contacts belonging to this user are removed, and not contacts belonging to other users with similar names or email addresses.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • user – User: Identify the user who is making the request

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

The contact object that was removed from the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactUpdate): The updated information for the specified contact. user (User): The user who is making this request, used to verify that they are authorized to make this change.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be deleted

  • body – ContactUpdate: Pass in the updated contact information

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the token

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

async src.routes.notes.update_note(body: NoteUpdate, note_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_note function updates a note in the database.
The function takes three arguments:

  • body: A NoteUpdate object containing the new values for the note.

  • note_id: An integer representing the ID of an existing note to be updated.

    This is passed as a path parameter, not as part of JSON request body. It’s also validated by FastAPI using Pydantic models and OpenAPI schemas, so it will always be an integer when it reaches this function (unless there’s some other bug).

Parameters:

  • body – NoteUpdate: Get the data that is being passed in from the request body

  • note_id – int: Identify the note to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is currently logged in

Returns:

A note object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.notes.update_status_note(body: NoteStatusUpdate, note_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_status_note function updates the status of a note.

The function takes in a NoteStatusUpdate object, which contains the new status for the note. It also takes in an integer representing the id of the note to be updated and two optional parameters:

  • db: A database session that is used to query data from our database (defaults to Depends(get_db))

  • current_user: The user who is making this request (defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user))

Parameters:

  • body – NoteStatusUpdate: Get the status of the note from the request body

  • note_id – int: Get the note id from the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is logged in

Returns:

A note object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.tags.read_tag(tag_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The read_tag function will return a single tag from the database.

The function takes in an integer, which is the id of the tag to be returned. It also takes in a Session object and a User object, both of which are used by other functions that read_tag calls.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – int: Specify the id of the tag to be read

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Ensure that the user is authenticated

Returns:

A tag object

Doc-author:

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n tags

  • limit – int: Limit the number of tags returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

A list of tags

async src.routes.tags.remove_tag(tag_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The remove_tag function removes a tag from the database.

The function takes in an integer representing the id of the tag to be removed, and returns a dictionary containing information about that tag.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – int: Get the tag id from the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is logged in

Returns:

The tag that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.tags.update_tag(body: TagModel, tag_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_tag function updates a tag in the database.
The function takes three arguments:

  • body: A TagModel object containing the new values for the tag.

  • tag_id: An integer representing the ID of an existing tag to be updated. This is passed as part of a URL path parameter, e.g., /tags/{tag_id}.

  • db (optional): A Session object that represents an open connection to a PostgreSQL database instance, which will be used by SQLAlchemy’s ORM layer to perform CRUD operations on tags and their relationships with other entities in our application’s

Parameters:

  • body – TagModel: Pass in the new tag information

  • tag_id – int: Specify the id of the tag to be deleted

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

An updated tag

Doc-author:

Trelent

The update_avatar_user function is used to update the avatar of a user.

The function takes in an UploadFile object, which is a file that has been uploaded by the client. It also takes in the current_user and db objects as dependencies.

Parameters:

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

The updated user

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes in the token that was sent to the user’s email and uses it to get their email address. Then, it gets the user from our database using their email address and checks if they exist. If they don’t exist, we return an error message saying &quot;Verification error&quot;. If they do exist, we check if their account has already been confirmed or not. If it has been confirmed already, we return a message saying &quot;Your email is already confirmed&quot;.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A message if the email is already confirmed or confirms the email

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes in the username and password of the user, and returns an access token if successful. The access token can be used to make authenticated requests.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Validate the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token (bearer).

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the header

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A dictionary with the new access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their account. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the user’s email address. It then checks if there is already a confirmed account associated with that email address, and returns an error message if so. If not, it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user, but it does not actually send an email

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes in a UserModel object, which is validated by pydantic. If the email already exists, it will return an HTTP 409 error code (conflict). Otherwise, it will create a new user and send them an email to verify their account.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the user information from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the server

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository function

Returns:

A dictionary with the user and a detail message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.read_note(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The read_note function will return a single note from the database.

The contact_id parameter is used to find the specific note in question. If no such contact exists, an HTTP 404 error is returned.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id that is passed in the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

The contact that was found in the database

Doc-author:

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), curent_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

The function takes in an integer representing the id of the contact to be removed, and returns a dictionary containing information about that contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be removed

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • curent_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The removed contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdate, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), curent_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
The function takes three arguments:

  • body: A ContactUpdate object containing the new values for the contact’s fields.

  • contact_id: An integer representing the ID of an existing contact to be updated.

    This is passed as a path parameter, so it must be included in any request URL that calls this function.

  • db (optional): A Session object used to access and modify data stored in a database using SQLAlchemy ORM methods.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactUpdate: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository_contacts

  • curent_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The updated contact, which is then returned to the client

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.
Args:
data (dict): A dictionary containing all the information that will be stored in the JWT.

This should include any relevant user information, such as their username and email address. The only required key is &quot;sub&quot;, which stands for subject and must contain a unique identifier for each user, such as their ID from your database or UUID4 string.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes and methods

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

A jwt token that contains the following information:

Doc-author:

AR

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes in a dictionary of data and returns an encoded token. The function first creates a copy of the data dictionary, then adds two keys to it: iat (issued at) and exp (expiration). It then encodes the new dictionary using JWT with our secret key.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s email address

Returns:

A token

Doc-author:

AR

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the refresh token expires. Defaults to None, which sets it to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s id and username

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

An encoded refresh token, which is a jwt

Doc-author:

AR

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token.

The function takes in a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if successful. If unsuccessful, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user

Doc-author:

AR

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user if it’s valid, otherwise raises an HTTPException with status code 401.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the class itself

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

AR

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. It does this by decoding the JWT using our secret key, then returning the sub (subject) field of the payload.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Pass the token that is sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email address associated with the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as an argument and returns the hashed version of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object’s hash method, which uses bcrypt to generate a secure hash.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass the password that is to be hashed

Returns:

A string of the hashed password

Doc-author:

AR

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that is being checked

  • hashed_password – Verify the plain_password parameter

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

AR

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.mail.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address. :param email: EmailStr: Validate the email address, :param username: str: Pass the username to the email template :param host: str: Pass the host name to the template :return: A coroutine, so we need to use await or yield from :doc-author: AR
